name: Verify underwriter should able to perform Reinstatement with Lapse and the same is updated in Billing

testSteps.description: 1: Verify underwriter should able to perform Reinstatement with Lapse and the same is updated in Billing ({ReasonForReinstatement=Reinstatement Regular, ReinstatementWithLapse=Yes})

children.description: Given Underwriter creates policy successfully

When underwriter perform cancellation on policy with given details as
| CancelType | CancelReason |
| Flat | Agent of Record |
Then policy transaction action should be 'cancellation'
Given underwriter completes transaction and policy is cancelled successfully
When Reinstatement is performed on policy  with 'Reinstatement Regular' and 'Yes' transaction effective date + 15 days
And underwriter completes transaction and policy is Reinstated successfully
And transaction premium should be calculated as multiplication of cancellation transaction premium and prorate factor
And underwriter is on home page
And underwriter navigates to Billing Workbench
And underwriter searches for the policy in billing workbench
And underwriter Navigates to Transaction Details for Reinstated Transaction
Then Transaction Type should be in 'Reinstatement' is updated on Billing

testSteps.description: 2: Verify underwriter should able to perform Reinstatement with Lapse and the same is updated in Billing ({ReasonForReinstatement=Reinstatement due to carrier error on last cancellation, ReinstatementWithLapse=Yes})

children.description: Given Underwriter creates policy successfully

When underwriter perform cancellation on policy with given details as
| CancelType | CancelReason |
| Flat | Agent of Record |
Then policy transaction action should be 'cancellation'
Given underwriter completes transaction and policy is cancelled successfully
When Reinstatement is performed on policy  with 'Reinstatement due to carrier error on last cancellation' and 'Yes' transaction effective date + 15 days
And underwriter completes transaction and policy is Reinstated successfully
And transaction premium should be calculated as multiplication of cancellation transaction premium and prorate factor
And underwriter is on home page
And underwriter navigates to Billing Workbench
And underwriter searches for the policy in billing workbench
And underwriter Navigates to Transaction Details for Reinstated Transaction
Then Transaction Type should be in 'Reinstatement' is updated on Billing

testSteps.description: 3: Verify underwriter should able to perform Reinstatement with Lapse and the same is updated in Billing ({ReasonForReinstatement=Reinstatement due to change in Cancellation effective date and/or Reason for Cancellation Code, ReinstatementWithLapse=Yes})

testSteps.description: 4: Verify underwriter should able to perform Reinstatement with Lapse and the same is updated in Billing ({ReasonForReinstatement=Reinstatement due to carrier consideration-late reinstatement submitted by carrier to accommodate insured, ReinstatementWithLapse=Yes})

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
Given underwriter completes transaction and policy is cancelled successfully
When Reinstatement is performed on policy  with '<ReasonForReinstatement>' and '<ReinstatementWithLapse>' transaction effective date + 15 days
And underwriter completes transaction and policy is Reinstated successfully
And transaction premium should be calculated as multiplication of cancellation transaction premium and prorate factor
And underwriter is on home page
And underwriter navigates to Billing Workbench
And underwriter searches for the policy in billing workbench
And underwriter Navigates to Transaction Details for Reinstated Transaction
Then Transaction Type should be in 'Reinstatement' is updated on Billing
